                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>In 1993, Eastern Charlotte Waterways (ECW) was established. Its first action was to assess the freshwater of eastern Charlotte County, New Brunswick. For two years beginning in the summer of 1994, the organization’s members visited ten watersheds between June and November, monitoring an upstream and downstream site for water temperature, pH, dissolved oxygen, and turbidity. They also monitored four popular swim locations for fecal coliform bacteria. The results of this study were published in “The watersheds of eastern Charlotte: Environmental quality assessment”. Twenty years later, in 2014-2015 the assessment has been replicated by ECW staff to identify any changes in water quality.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

name: 10-25976-kc1x-bc80
notes: In 1993, Eastern Charlotte Waterways (ECW) was established. Its first action was to assess the freshwater of eastern Charlotte County, New Brunswick. For two years beginning in the summer of 1994, the organization’s members visited ten watersheds between June and November, monitoring an upstream and downstream site for water temperature, pH, dissolved oxygen, and turbidity. They also monitored four popular swim locations for fecal coliform bacteria. The results of this study were published in “The watersheds of eastern Charlotte: Environmental quality assessment”. Twenty years later, in 2014-2015 the assessment has been replicated by ECW staff to identify any changes in water quality.

notes_translated.en: In 1993, Eastern Charlotte Waterways (ECW) was established. Its first action was to assess the freshwater of eastern Charlotte County, New Brunswick. For two years beginning in the summer of 1994, the organization’s members visited ten watersheds between June and November, monitoring an upstream and downstream site for water temperature, pH, dissolved oxygen, and turbidity. They also monitored four popular swim locations for fecal coliform bacteria. The results of this study were published in “The watersheds of eastern Charlotte: Environmental quality assessment”. Twenty years later, in 2014-2015 the assessment has been replicated by ECW staff to identify any changes in water quality.
notes_translated.fr: En 1993, Eastern Charlotte Waterways (ECW) a été créée. Sa première action a été d'évaluer l'eau douce de l'est du comté de Charlotte, au Nouveau-Brunswick. Pendant deux ans, à compter de l'été 1994, les membres de l'organisation ont visité dix bassins versants entre juin et novembre, surveillant la température de l'eau, le pH, l'oxygène dissous et la turbidité d'un site en amont et en aval. Ils ont également surveillé quatre lieux de baignade populaires pour détecter la présence de coliformes fécaux. Les résultats de cette étude ont été publiés dans « The watersheds of eastern Charlotte : Environmental quality assessment ». Vingt ans plus tard, en 2014-2015, l'évaluation a été reproduite par le personnel de l'ECW pour identifier tout changement dans la qualité de l'eau.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Eastern Charlotte Waterways: Freshwater quality data from the Outer Bay of Fundy watershed complex

title_translated.en: Eastern Charlotte Waterways: Freshwater quality data from the Outer Bay of Fundy watershed complex
title_translated.fr: Voies navigables de l'est de Charlotte : données sur la qualité de l'eau douce provenant du complexe hydrographique de l'extérieur de la baie de Fundy

title_translation_method.fr: Title text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate
